sentences: Needis ja vandus oma reetlikke kaaslasi.
Ole sa, olgu ta, olgu nad, olge te neetud!
context: The word 'neetud' is the past participle form of the Estonian verb 'needma', which means to curse, damn, or condemn. It's used when expressing strong anger, condemnation, or invoking a curse upon someone or something. In its adjective form (as in this example), it can mean 'cursed' or 'damned'. The word carries religious and emotional connotations of eternal damnation or severe judgment.
